column4: hallo can someone please tell me im triing to compile clamav and i need a compiler wich one should i use???
you don't need to compailed it
if you open your package manager and search for clam you'll find it in there, pre-compiled ready for use
I assure you, you don't need to compile it
have you setup a clamav server with safesquid???
what compiler do you think i should load???i have loaded gcc
well, the documents I've just read on it, say nothing about needing to compile it
safe-squid just needs to access the pre-compiled clam daemon - you do not need to compile it
what makes you say that ?
I suspect its something stupid like the safe-squid user hasn't got the correct permissions to the clam socket file
why do you think it's the version ?
I've just read 3 documents (skimmed I'll grant you) and none of them require you to compile clam to work
so ?
don't just blindly do things
investigate
what is the error your getting ? why do you think it's a version issue (whats your clue)
I'm still waiting for some sort of debug info or something that gives you a clue that it's a clam av version issue
no - that means safe-squid and clamav are not talking to either other....thats all
well, as I said look into it, check the log files, check why they can't talk, then fix it
rather than blindly assuming things and doing things
i dont know what i did now but it works with precompiled files and the same squid....
